shorts.title: Lackawanna County contract with SEIU to save $1.2M in health care costs
shorts.title_distilled: Lackawanna County contract with SEIU to save $1.
shorts.description: The Lackawanna County Commissioners unanimously ratified a four-year contract Tuesday with the Service Employees International Union that will save the county $1.2 million in health care costs
shorts.content: The Lackawanna County Commissioners unanimously ratified a four-year contract Tuesday with the Service Employees International Union that will save the county $1.2 million in health care costs
shorts.content_distilled: Lackawanna County Commissioners unanimously ratified a four-year contract Tuesday with the Service Employees International Union that will save the county $1.

shorts.title: Fidelity Bank Welcomes James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to Board of Directors
shorts.title_distilled: Fidelity Bank Welcomes James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A.
shorts.description: DUNMORE, Pa., Jan. 02, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Brian J. Cali, Chairman of the Board of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce the appointment of James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to its Board of Directors.
shorts.content: DUNMORE, Pa., Jan. 02, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Brian J. Cali, Chairman of the Board of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce the appointment of James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to its Board of Directors.

shorts.title: HS WRESTLING: Abington Heights powers past West Scranton
shorts.title_distilled: HS WRESTLING: Abington Heights powers past West Scranton.
shorts.description: SCRANTON — Down by one point in the third period, Abington Heights wrestler Braghan Pallis looked to the sideline. “Honestly, the reason that match ended that way was really my coach looking at me and saying to me, ‘This is where you show your heart. This is where you need to show heart,’” Pallis said. “I’m not the best kid on the team, and I find that my part on this team is showing leadership and giving my all when I need to give my all. And that was a moment I was like it’s now or never.” The Comets […]
shorts.content: SCRANTON — Down by one point in the third period, Abington Heights wrestler Braghan Pallis looked to the sideline. “Honestly, the reason that match ended that way was really my coach looking at me and saying to me, ‘This is where you show your heart. This is where you need to show heart,’” Pallis said. “I’m not the best kid on the team, and I find that my part on this team is showing leadership and giving my all when I need to give my all. And that was a moment I was like it’s now or never.” The Comets […]

shorts.title: Canines changing lives: Eynon-Archbald Lions’ Snowflake Gala benefits Leader Dogs for the Blind
shorts.title_distilled: Canines changing lives: Eynon-Archbald Lions’ Snowflake Gala benefits Leader Dogs for the Blind.
shorts.description: The Eynon-Archbald Lions Club is helping to change lives this winter with its annual Snowflake Gala. The gala will be held Saturday, Jan. 24, at Fiorelli Catering in Peckville from 6 to 10 p.m. and will benefit Leader Dogs for the Blind and the club’s community events.
shorts.content: The Eynon-Archbald Lions Club is helping to change lives this winter with its annual Snowflake Gala. The gala will be held Saturday, Jan. 24, at Fiorelli Catering in Peckville from 6 to 10 p.m. and will benefit Leader Dogs for the Blind and the club’s community events.
shorts.content_distilled: Eynon-Archbald Lions Club is helping to change lives this winter with its annual Snowflake Gala.

shorts.title: Why the Y: Make the Y your place in the new year
shorts.title_distilled: Why the Y: Make the Y your place in the new year.
shorts.description: The start of a new year is a chance to reset, refocus, and reconnect — and there’s no better place to do that than at the Greater Scranton YMCA.

shorts.title: School Briefs 1/8/26
shorts.description: Elmira College Niall Wildman of Olyphant was named to the dean’s list for the fall 2025 term. To qualify for the dean’s list, full-time undergraduate students must earn a term grade point average of 3.6 or higher. PennWest University The following local students were named to the dean’s list for the fall 2025 semester: Aaron Fontanella, a PennWest Edinboro student from Archbald. Fontanella is pursuing a Bachelor of Arts in English and a certificate in literature and culture. Howard Solsman, a PennWest Global Online student from Dickson City. Solsman is pursuing a Bachelor of Arts in sociology. Hope Rivera, a […]
